text: Braemar Hill, formerly called Causeway Bay South before 1994, is one of the 35 constituencies in the Eastern District. The constituency returns one district councillor to the Eastern District Council, with an election every four years. The seat is currently held by Peter Shiu of the Liberal Party. Braemar Hill constituency is loosely based on Braemar Hill with estimated population of 16,259. ==Councillors represented== {| class="wikitable" |- !colspan="2"|Election!!Member!!Party |- |style="background-color: " | | 1994 | Chan Bing-woon | Independent |- |style="background-color: " | | 2007 | Peter Shiu Ka-fai | Liberal |- |style="background-color: " | | 2019 | Kenny Yuen Kin-chung | Liberal |- |} ==Election results== ===2010s=== ===2000s=== ===1990s=== ==References== Category:Braemar Hill Category:Constituencies of Hong Kong Category:Constituencies of Eastern District Council Category:1994 establishments in Hong Kong Category:Constituencies established in 1994
title: Braemar Hill (constituency)
